page.title: 15Clay Cross Tunnel
page.content: The Clay Cross Tunnel was begun in February 1837 and was completed in August 1839.The Tunnel is 1 and a quarter kilometers long.The people who built the Tunnel were called navvies,masons and brick layers. The navvies,who lived in sod huts,were paid on contract,according to the work they did.Others were paid in bread and beer. The tunnel has 15,000,000 bricks. Clay dug out of the tunnel was used to make bricks.Coal found in the tunnel heated the kilns to fire bricks.The kilns were in or along side the tunnel.There are air shafts all over Clay Cross. Air shafts were used to let steam or smoke out of the Tunnel. The Tunnel was built as part of the 72 mile stretch of the Leeds Derby railway,and is still standing and in use today.
